Project Overview

The goal is to support low-budget scouting .

title: Methodology
text:
Source: Kaggle (https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/furkanuluta/football-manager-22-complete-player-dataset)
Base Year : 2022-2023, for methodology evaluation and simulations
Previous Year : 2021-2022 , for players search
Player attributes

The process of evaluation how the data from FM in a specific league are close to reality is simple. First the CA of each player is calculated , then for each team the average CA of the best 16 players is calculated (see Top.n).To assess how closely the FM data matches reality, teams are first ranked according to their CA values. The rank differences between the CA-based order and the actual league standings are then calculated to measure how far the FM rankings deviate from real performance.

Top.n = the best players of the team based on the CA , which are used for the evaluation of the teams’s CA.
Accuracy = represents the percentage of teams whose CA-based ranking matches their actual league position, indicating how many teams FM correctly places in the real standings.
MARE (Mean Absolute Rank Error) = represents the average difference between the ranking of each team based on FM’s CA and their actual league ranking.

title: About
text:
Motivation
This project was created to explore how longitudinal player attribute data can be used to support scouting and youth development decisions, particularly for clubs operating with limited resources.

title: About
text:
Approach
Rather than relying on static player snapshots, the platform analyzes multi-season development trajectories to identify late bloomers, retention candidates, and undervalued profiles.

title: About
text:
Intended Use
The scouting application is designed for analysts, scouts, and technically minded football professionals who want analytical support in player evaluation rather than automated recommendations.

title: About
text:
Transparency
The analysis is based on Football Manager data and is intended as a decision-support tool. Outputs should be interpreted as guidance rather than definitive assessments.

title: Methodology
text:
Approach
The proposed approach is designed to remain as unbiased as possible by anchoring all player evaluation to the characteristics of the existing squad in the base year. Rather than searching the entire player universe, the model identifies players from the previous season whose profiles are comparable or improve upon to the players currently occupying each role in the team. This relative, role-based comparison ensures that recommendations are contextualized within the team’s actual needs and constraints, reducing selection bias and overfitting to league-wide averages.
By sourcing candidates from the prior year, the approach avoids forward-looking leakage while still capturing players with demonstrated performance stability. Once candidate players are identified, the framework evaluates how one or multiple transfers would alter the team’s internal dynamics, particularly in terms of collective ability and wage structure. This allows the user to assess not only individual upgrades but also the systemic impact of transfer decisions on squad balance and total budget, supporting informed trade-offs between performance gains and financial sustainability.
